PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_UndergroundExcavationCommon
PropertySetDef.Definition: Common properties for underground excavation elements.

ConstantDef.Name: HAND
ConstantDef.Definition: Manual excavation method using hand tools.

ConstantDef.Name: EXCAVATOR
ConstantDef.Definition: Mechanized method utilizing excavator machinery for efficient large-scale underground earthmoving.

ConstantDef.Name: JACKHAMMER
ConstantDef.Definition: Pneumatic or hydraulic percussion tool breaking rock or concrete.

ConstantDef.Name: RIPPER
ConstantDef.Definition: Equipment with a toothed tool to break and loosen hard soil.

ConstantDef.Name: DRILLANDBLAST
ConstantDef.Definition: A method of desintegrating rock by drilling small diameter holes on a planned layout, packing these with explosives and then firing to a fixed program to shatter the rock in a desired form.

ConstantDef.Name: ROADHEADER
ConstantDef.Definition: Machine with rotating cutter head specifically designed for the excavation of roadways, tunnels, and underground chambers.

ConstantDef.Name: TBMOPENWITHGRIPPERS
ConstantDef.Definition: An open rock tunnel boring machine which generally utilizes roller disc cutters as excavation tools and which moves forward by reacting against the tunnel walls through a hydraulic gripper reaction system.

ConstantDef.Name: TBMCLOSEDWITHGRIPPERS
ConstantDef.Definition: A closed-face shield which generally utilizes roller disc cutters as excavation tools and which moves forward by reacting against the tunnel walls through a hydraulic gripper reaction system.

ConstantDef.Name: TBMEARTHPRESSUREFACESUPPORT
ConstantDef.Definition: A closed-face shield designed for tunnelling in fine-grained soils by trapping excavated materials against the face and removing them at a rate slow enough to maintain pressures that counterbalance earth pressures exerted against the cutterhead and prevent ingress of water; which moves forward by reacting against an installed lining.

ConstantDef.Name: TBMSLURRYPRESSUREFACESUPPORT
ConstantDef.Definition: A closed-face shield designed for tunnelling in very soft, wet, or running ground by use of circulating, pressurized clay slurry against the face to counterbalance earth pressures exerted against the cutterhead, prevent ingress of water and also to carry away the excavated material; which moves forward by reacting against an installed lining.

ConstantDef.Name: TBMAIRPRESSUREFACESUPPORT
ConstantDef.Definition: A closed-face shield designed for tunnelling in unstable soils with the presence of water where compressed air is used to counterbalance earth pressures exerted against the cutterhead; which moves forward by reacting against an installed lining.

ConstantDef.Name: TBMMIXSHIELD
ConstantDef.Definition: A closed-face shield with a mixed face support system that combines various methods to counterbalance earth pressures exerted against the cutterhead; which moves forward by reacting against an installed lining.

ConstantDef.Name: SHAFTBORINGMACHINE
ConstantDef.Definition: Specialized machine for boring vertical or inclined shafts.

ConstantDef.Name: RAISEDRILL
ConstantDef.Definition: Type of shaft boring machine that enlarges a pilot hole by reaming to the full shaft diameter from the bottom to the top of the shaft.

PropertyDef.Name: SupportClass
PropertyDef.Definition: Specifies a class defining the support measures for underground excavation.

PropertyDef.Name: ExcavationClass
PropertyDef.Definition: Specifies an excavation class used in underground excavation.

PropertyDef.Name: RoundLength
PropertyDef.Definition: Length of individual round or drive.
